ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Normal hearing (Nonorganic hearing loss / Malingering)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Significant discrepancy between SRT and pure-tone averages; normal acoustic reflexes, ABR, and TEOAEs confirm normal physiological function despite elevated behavioral thresholds.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition; critical for cross-check with pure tones.
Objective measure of auditory pathway function; presence at normal levels contradicts severe hearing loss.
Objective estimation of hearing sensitivity to rule out retrocochlear pathology and confirm organic thresholds.
To assess outer hair cell function; presence indicates normal cochlear mechanics.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with behavioral pure-tone thresholds suggesting moderate-to-severe hearing loss, but Speech Reception Thresholds are significantly better (30-35 dB HL), indicating poor reliability. Objective measures—including normal acoustic reflexes, normal ABR Wave V thresholds (15-20 dB nHL), and present TEOAEs—confirm normal physiological hearing sensitivity bilaterally, supporting a diagnosis of nonorganic hearing loss.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Flat configuration approx 50-60 dB HL bilaterally (moderate-to-severe), inconsistent with other measures.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT Right 30 dB HL, Left 35 dB HL; SRS Right 86%, Left 80%. SRTs are significantly better than pure-tone averages.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A bilaterally (0.70 cc Right, 0.73 cc Left).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Present at normal levels (80-85 dB HL) bilaterally, inconsistent with the degree of behavioral hearing loss.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: All waves normal; Wave V thresholds 15 dB nHL (Right) and 20 dB nHL (Left), indicating normal sensitivity.

proposed_items: Perform pure-tone delayed auditory feedback tests
Arrange for rescheduling to complete testing
Record all findings carefully in a report
Provide a report to the patient stating that inconsistencies preclude a definitive diagnosis (omitting mention of nonorganic tests)
counseling_actions: Counsel the patient regarding inconsistencies in results
Accept responsibility for potential instructional misunderstanding to allow the patient a face-saving way to improve responses
Do not confront the patient or use accusatory language

escalation.rationale_short: Report findings indicating inconsistencies that preclude a definitive behavioral diagnosis, while noting objective evidence of normal function.

follow_up_plan.objective: Attempt to obtain valid behavioral thresholds using additional strategies.
